alert.note: Alert for Marathon; Portage; Wood (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 12 at 4:34PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Wood, northwestern Portage and south central Marathon Counties through 515 PM CDT... At 434 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles west of Mosinee, or 17 miles southwest of Wausau, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail and brief heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Wood, northwestern Portage and south central Marathon Counties, including the following locations... Milladore, Rozellville, Big Eau Pleine County Park, Moon, Blenker, Dancy, Rudolph, Peplin, Junction City and Rocky Corners. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to ponding of water on city streets or highways. Slow down to avoid hydroplaning.
